P102807.project_name: Avian and Human Influenza Control and Prevention

keywords.cdata: action plan, Agriculture, Avian Influenza, clinics, Components, computers, equipment, equipments, extension, faxes, Financial Management, financial reports, implementing agencies, implementing agency, information technology, laboratory equipment, legal framework, Poultry, Poultry Production, procurement, Project management, public safety, result, vaccination campaign, vaccines, Veterinary, veterinary clinics, Veterinary Services

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Avian and Human Influenza Control and Prevention Project is to minimize the threat posed to humans and poultry in Egypt by Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) infection and other zoonoses in domestic poultry and to prepare for, control and respond to an avian influenza pandemic and other infectious diseases emerging in humans. The changes will reallocate the savings from the cancelled $2.1 million procurement of Avian Influenza vaccines to provide laboratory equipments for a Biosafety Level 3 (BSL3) laboratory facility at the ministry of agriculture. Savings from cancelled procurement of vaccination equipment and from other completed contracts add up to additional savings of about $1.1 million. It is that the additional savings will be used to procure motorcycles and information technology equipment (laptop computers, internet connection, faxes) for the benefit of local veterinary clinics to enhance their capacity for disease management, surveillance, and reporting.
